meanings.definition: To make modern in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to modernize their website to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Many people choose to modernize their homes by adding smart technology.
meanings.sent3: The old car tried to modernize itself by wearing a flashy new paint job.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit modernized the room, standing out like a neon sign in a sea of black.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline was modernized by the addition of a sleek new skyscraper.

meanings.definition: To adapt to modern needs or habits.
meanings.sent1: Schools are constantly modernizing their curriculum to keep up with changing times.
meanings.sent2: It is important for businesses to modernize their practices to stay competitive.
meanings.sent3: The old dog tried to modernize its routine by learning new tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills modernized over time, becoming more efficient and creative.
meanings.sent5: The town's infrastructure was modernized to accommodate the growing population.
